module.title: Linux Basic Commands and Navigation
module.description: This module teaches foundational Linux commands for navigation, account management, and system information.

tasks.title: Navigating the File System
tasks.description: Learn to move between directories, list files, and check current directory.
instructions: Use `ls` to list files in a directory.
Use `pwd` to show the current directory path.
tasks.expected_outcome: User can navigate to specified directories and display the contents of directories.
tasks.feedback: Remember to use `ls -a` to see hidden files, and `cd ..` to move up a directory.

tasks.title: Changing Passwords
tasks.description: Learn to change user passwords securely.
instructions: Use the `passwd` command to change the password for a user account.
tasks.expected_outcome: User successfully changes the password for the specified account.
tasks.feedback: Ensure that the new password meets security criteria set by the system.

tasks.title: Deleting User Accounts
tasks.description: Learn how to delete a user account securely.
instructions: Use the `userdel` command to delete a user account.
tasks.expected_outcome: User can delete specified accounts safely.
tasks.feedback: Confirm that all user data is removed before deleting.

tasks.title: Check Logged In Users
tasks.description: Learn to check who is currently logged into the system.
instructions: Use the `who` or `w` command to view active sessions.
tasks.expected_outcome: User can view all active user sessions on the system.
tasks.feedback: Consider using `last` to check previous logins for audit purposes.

tasks.title: Identify Running Services
tasks.description: Learn to list and check running services on the system.
instructions: Use `ps`, `top`, or `systemctl` to identify active services and processes.
tasks.expected_outcome: User can identify running processes and services.
tasks.feedback: Use `systemctl | grep running` to filter active services.
